dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOD splatters on white paper. Pull back to see a CHEF w a cut finger standing at the admitting counter, dripping  blood on a form. The uptight Parisian NURSE scolds him an pulls out a new form. ANDY, lugging his back pack, trudges through the sliding  glass doors marked "St. Severin Hospital". Bleary eyed, h over, burdened by a heavy backpack and carrying the crump telegram, he approaches ANOTHER NURSE at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, excuse me... hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STOUT WOMAN with a POODLE charges in front of Andy and  launches into a loud French argument with the nurse over hospital's "human's only" admission policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Pitou needs a real doctor! He's  melancholy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy tries to push his way back in, but the shrill little dog yaps at him. Andy grabs his aching "hangover head" in agony. The bleeding chef walks away, dripping, leaving th other nurse free. Andy approaches her. She has her head d in some paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon... Excusez moi. 'Allo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking up, she holds up a "please wait" finger.  Andy sighs. The poodle yaps at him again. He winces and t to get the nurse's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nurse) Umm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises her finger sharply and glares at him. She goes back to her paperwork. Andy starts chatting politely with her, pretending she's responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you ever been to Spain? You'd  love it. It's friendly, sunny,  cheap... And you'd be the only raving  bitch there instead of just one in  the crowd up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCEL BOULARD, a short middle aged cop in a rumpled coat approaches. He taps Andy on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew Mc-dair-mo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's McDermott, but yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel flashes his badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Boulard. We've been  expecting you. This is Inspector  Leduc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEDUC, in his fifties, taller, heavy set, droopy mustache nods gruffly and starts towards the elevator, motioning f them to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in charge but, uh, between you  and me, my English is better. (they hurry to catch  up with LeDuc) This way... So you're from New York  eh? I love those Hill Street Blues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Listen, my uncle, it's not  serious is it? Did he eat some bad  snails? Slip on the bidet? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step into the elevator as LeDuc holds the door open. Marcel and LeDuc trade uneasy glances. LeDuc sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah okay. My French isn't that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERRENCE lies comatose under a clear plastic oxygen tent. ORDERLY changes the dressing on his bloody stumps. A NURS fiddles with the vast array of bleeping, burbling, suckin life support machinery. Andy, dumb struck, watches from a few paces away. Marcel, pad in hand, asks him questions. LeDuc stays in the  background, listening and studying Andy intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How well did, er, do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too well. He taught at the  Sorbonne, right? Dad always calls  him his "hippie brother". Did some  work with Timothy Leary I think, and -  Is he... is he going to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The doctors say the machines  should keep him going a long time.  But basically he is, how you say, a  legume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legume? You mean, a vegetable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vegetable, right. My mistake. It  seems he was attacked by a maniac,  maybe two or three maniacs, just  after midnight. yesterday. They fled  into the tunnels beneath Paris, that's  all we know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, maniacs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here's what I think happened.  A chemistry professor goes to a bad  part of town late at night. Why?  Perhaps he's making a few francs on  the side. The psychedelic drug market  is big these days. He gets mixed up  with a bad crowd and, like they say,  if you lie with dogs, you get fleas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, these fleas must have  teeth like fuckin' chain saws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP BEEP! Something's wrong with uncle Terrence's machin The IV bottle is sputtering and bubbling, the EKG monitor flashing. The orderlies snap into action and pull the cur shut, waving "no problem" to Andy and Marcel. Marcel lead Andy away, trying to calm him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go now. You must be  very tired. We'll call if any new -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this. Why don't you  go down in the tunnels and find the  goddamn... animals that attacked my  uncle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, it's not so easy. There are  hundreds of kilometers of tunnels  under Paris. It's a whole other city,  crawling with drug addicts, lunatics,  skinheads... It's no man's land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's about to protest when LeDuc steps in and hands him uncle Terrence's leather bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle was carrying this. The  keys to his apartment are in there.  I talked to his assistant, Madame  Flocquet. You'll be staying there a  while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess so. (they walk him to the  elevator) Did he say anything? Before the coma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the name of this hospital, St.  Severin. He repeated it a few times  then he lost consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he pick this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. There were others much  closer. He was religious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you're about to pop off,  what have you got to lose? Thanks  for your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's dumfounded at Marcel's lack of tact. The elevator  doors start to close. LeDuc nods "good-bye". Marcel leans and sneaks in one last comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And remember Andy, let's be careful  out there. Heh-heh... Ouch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors knock him on the head as they close. A shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Inspector Clouseau, on the case.  Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy opens the gate of this beautiful 19th century buildi and walks through THE COURTYARD to the main entrance. A P yaps at him. The dog is in the open doorway of the Concie apartment, which opens into the courtyard. The nosy conci MADAME CHRETIEN calls the dog, LULU, back in and shuts th door. Andy enters the dark LOBBY, finds the timed auto shut-off light switch and turns it on. He boards the old fashioned wire cage elevator and presses the button for #4. McDermo The elevator ascends painstakingly slowly. Andy resigns  himself to waiting, thumbs through his uncle's date book. Andy turns to the day Uncle Terrence was attacked. A circ cryptic entry at the bottom of the page reads "Meet Claud Medusa - 11:00". Andy wrinkles his brow. At this second, light goes out. Andy ascends the rest of the way in darkness. The doors o on the fourth floor. He gets out and finds his way to the apartment. He tries a key in the lock. It won't turn. He  jiggles it. No luck. He goes through this with two more k grumbling under his breath. Finally he finds the right on He pushes the door open and gasps. He's face to face with a scary TRIBAL MASK hanging in the entrance way. It startles him for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy walks in and sets down his bags. A gun COCKS. A youn woman's voice screams at him in French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in French) Who are you!? What do you want!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to see SERAFINE, a beautiful young woman, around 22, casually dressed and aiming a pistol at his head. He  drops the shoulder bag and reaches for the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot! Jesus... uh... Je  m'appelle Andy. McDermott. Je suis  le... um, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It dawns on her. She drops the gun to her side, embarrass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English) Oh fuck, you are his nephew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's the word. And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine Flocquet. I work for your  uncle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You? You're Madame Flocquet? I  pictured a fat lady with an apron,  not - I don't know - La Femme Nikita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine puts the gun away in a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounded like someone picking the  lock. After what happened, I guess I  am a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I can follow that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fucking nightmare, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. True. The cops weren't much  help either. Their theory is he was  moonlighting as a drug dealer or  something. Make sense to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police. They have their head in their  asshole and they still can't find  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well put. So, what exactly has uncle  Terrence been up to lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he speaks, he scans the apartment. It's cluttered with overwhelming assortment of anthropological oddities from  around the globe, medieval illustrations, molecular model and an artsy periodic table that's been used as a dart bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing a book with Professor  Roussel, about medieval chemistry. I  was just transcribing his notes onto  the computer and - oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She races out of the room. Andy follows after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs in and finds the computer locked up. She smacks a few times, clicks the mouse, taps the keyboard. No resp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salots! Shitfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts to her loose  grasp of American  slang) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you leave it for more than a few  minutes it locks up. Now I must reboot  and type a dozen fucking passwords.  He was security crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flicks a switch on the back of the computer, rebootin it. Andy pauses to look at some nearby photos of his uncl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't get over it. The cops  said it was a "maniac", but he looked  like, I don't know, like he'd gone  through a combine harvester or...  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine gets kind of emotional at the thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't let me see him. Family  only. I told them, Terry was almost  like a father to me, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy reacts to her use of the informal "Terry"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends. Was "Terry" a father like  Ward Cleaver or a father like Woody  Allen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. She grasps his meaning. She's offended. She start typing on the computer, giving him the cold shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must not have known him very  well. He's not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sorry if I was out of line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were. I have work to do. The  publisher wants the transcripts by  Monday. Go. Make yourself at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. My mistake. You know, I'm gonna  be a writer myself some day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy sees he's sunk. He heads for the door, but something the wall catches his eye. A small flyer on the bulletin b with a big drawing of Medusa. He takes it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medusa... What's this? some kind of  club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing. A stupid party. Not  really a night club, it's, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like an underground club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's a bad place. Weird people.  Strange things go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who's Claude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine looks at him hard, questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked through my uncle's date  book. Writer's curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to a paperback on the desk. It's French, with psychedelic cover depicting a man, half King Louis XIV, h witch doctor. The title, (in French) "History Inside Out Psychic Illumination Through the Ages" by Dr. Claude Rous A picture on the back shows an academic looking Claude in tweed jacket, with gray hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Claude Rousel. The one  your uncle was working with. He  teaches cultural history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an underground club? I'd like to  see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves the book in his back pocket. Serafine's emphati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. There's nothing for you  down there. It's dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. I'm from New York - the  "shoot me" state. Don't wait up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts for the door, She spins him around by the sleev

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly quite angry) What good can you do? Why are you  being so fucking stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting fired up) Maybe I didn't know him like you  did. But he's my uncle. And I owe it  to him to get some answers. It's a  quest like, uh, Hemingway, the Old  Man and The Sea. Except instead of  an old man I'm a young man, and  instead of the sea, it's a bunch of  tunnels under Paris. And instead of  a big fish it's... who knows? That's  what I'm going to find out. Au revoir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out of the office. She calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fucking lunatic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door slams. She looks after him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) God damned Americans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MEDUSA HEAD is carved in the stone above the doorway of crumbling old facade in a rundown Parisian neighborhood.  Andy tries the front door. It's locked. There's no sounds signs of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Some party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy starts off, then pauses as three PARTY GOERS approac the door. They're "modern-primitives" - tribal tattoos,  pierced noses, and weird beaded hair. One fishes a key fr the Medusa's mouth, opens the door, and lets the group in Andy slips in behind them. One GUY in the group looks And over and mutters something in French to his friends. They snigger amongst themselves and walk to a door across the  foyer. Andy follows, a few paces behind, through the door down some stairs, into

dialogues.speaker: A DILAPIDATED BASEMENT
dialogues.text: Lit with a few candles. They walk past an old boiler, thr another door, into

dialogues.speaker: A NARROW STONE SPIRAL STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: They proceed down the ancient stairway, also lit only by occasional candle placed on the steps. They reach the bot of the steps and enter a dark, drippy stone tunnel, still lit by candles. Some rats scurry away through the puddles under Andy's feet. Candles lead the way through the maze of intersecting tun Some graffiti scratched in the wall catches Andy's eye: " Philippe 1803". He pauses to look at it for and loses the group ahead of him. He follows the candles on his own, tu right, left, and left again. A loud, muffled bass beat ge louder. He rounds the corner into

dialogues.speaker: THE WILD UNDERGROUND PARTY SPACE
dialogues.text: In an open cavern, lit with torches and strobe lights. Tw hundred people are gyrating to eerie techno-tribal dance  music. It's a weird crowd, mostly young modern primitive  pierced and grungy RAVERS, many wearing day-glo tribal fa paint. Clusters of sullen, militant SKINHEADS hang around the periphery. An attractive, blissed-out WAIF approaches Andy with a  paintbrush and a jar of day-glo face paint and a brush. S goes to paint Andy's face. He stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright. I'll be a cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and pushes his hand down. He shrugs and lets h paint two day-glow red stripes on his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Fine... (with mock enthusiasm) Ooh. I can feel it tingling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy sniffs and makes a face - the paint has a weird smel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phew. What's in this stuff, liquid  plumber? (he pulls the book  out of his pocket  and shows her Claude's  picture) Do you know this guy? Claude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah oui, le professeur. La bas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to a dark alcove off the main cavern. Andy nod and starts off. We move in on a leather clad young man le against the wall, watching Andy go. This is GASTON DUFAUX self-styled Parisian thug, who seems to be cultivating a  sort of "Mickey Rourke" look. He takes a drag from his  cigarette and we see he's missing two fingers. Andy makes his way through the crowd. People are dancing  with wild abandon, and many carry torches. A SKINNY GUY I DIAPER and a paper mache skull mask runs through the crow ranting and spraying fluorescent silly string. He does a  weird dance around Andy and jabbers at him in French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, lemme get back to ya on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy approaches the side room and peers in. A small group young people are listening intently to CLAUDE, whose back to us. He's expounding about something in a solemn tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French, to group) ...How ironic. A man who dedicated  his life to opening the doors of the  mind now lies trapped behind them.  Locked behind a door without a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Andy as he steps around the crowd and sees Clau face. He looks older than in the photo - he's in his late fifties, with white hair and intense eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excusez moi, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude notices the book in Andy's hand. He speaks fluent  English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry my friend, I'm not signing  books right now. There's been a  tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm Andy McDermott. Terrence's  nephew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude is taken by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, I'm sorry. But how did you  find your way down here? Wait, let's  go talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He excuses himself from his "flock" and leads Andy to a q corner of the room. The kids disperse, several looking  sympathetically at Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's horrible. Terrence was one of  the most brilliant men I've known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, why did he hang out here?  The cops said it's dangerous -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops. It's their backward laws  that force all this underground in  the first place, endangering people  whose only crime is pushing the limits  of perception, exploring new states  of psychic awareness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're suddenly doused with day-glo silly string as the  gibbering idiot in the diaper pops in to deliver a rant a them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) The moon is bleeding! Prepare for  the downpour!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ducks back out. Andy picks the silly string out of his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychic awareness. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's silly. But do you  realize that young man is actually  in a deep sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on a new drug called ZBH, or  "Daydream". It allows the user to be  fully alert and mobile while he's  dreaming. He is literally conscious  and unconscious at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, that's like really groovy  and everything, but who hacked my  uncle's legs off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude frowns. He looks grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrence and I came down here to do  serious work. For centuries these  tunnels have been home to subcultures  mainstream society would not tolerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures to the main cavern, where people are far gone into various states... some in a trance, some gyrating lu to the eerily hypnotic music. We intercut with these imag as Claude speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people carry on traditions  dating back to pagan times - the  ancient quest for expanded  consciousness. At the same time  they're pioneering a chemical  revolution, powerful state-of-the- art compounds... But you know what I  mean.... (he gestures to Andy's  face paint) A year ago who would have dreamed of  topically applied hallucinogens like  TMD? Except Terry of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's eyes widen with comprehension. He touches his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!? Hallucinogen? Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rubs the face paint off with his shirt sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know? But then why did  you... well, don't worry. It's  relatively mild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well if I claw my face off,  just pack it in ice, okay? Jesus...  the cops were probably right. My  uncle was messed up with a bunch of  fry brains and they went berserk on  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude lowers his voice. He looks grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... We stumbled on something else  down here Andy. Something horrible,  almost unbelievable. But very real.  It's been going on for centuries,  though most people wouldn't believe  it, or wouldn't want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's somewhere between spooked and incredulous. He glan at the book in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second, are you like the Steven  King of France or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy turns and sees Serafine run up to him. She looks wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you came after all. Just in time,  it's getting interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must get out of here. It's not  safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs him by the arm. He resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you too -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch) My God! Serafine's right. It's time  to go. We'll talk soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon nuit Claude. (to Andy) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude dashes off. Serafine drags Andy into the main cave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, chill out a second!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads him across the cavern towards the entrance. And stops short and pulls away from her. It's not easy - she a strong grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, hold on. I'm not gonna get  dragged around like some kid in a  shopping mall. I want you to answer  some questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine sees something over Andy's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde. I knew I shouldn't have come  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy turns to see Gaston approaching. He leers at Serafin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Serafine, mon cher. I hear your boss  looks great in cut-offs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Get the fuck away from me, Gaston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) First you tell me where the ADM is,  eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his hand on her shoulder. Andy notices the missin fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoves his hand away and pulls Andy past him. Gaston  grabs her and spins her around. This time Andy grabs Gast hand and pulls it off her. He holds up Gaston's three fin hand and glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this explains the two fingers  they found in Liberace's asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston jerks his hand away. He stabs his finger in Andy's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Paris we have an expression for  people like you: Encul–π d'Americain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? In New York we got an expression  too. Goes like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! Andy hauls off and belts Gaston in the jaw as hard he can. But Gaston doesn't even lose his footing. He snee with rage and hits Andy with a vicious combination. His  glasses fly off as he reels into the crowd, knocking a fe people into a group of nearby SKINHEADS. The skinheads er into randomly directed violence - a full fledged BRAWL br out. It's chaos. On the floor, Andy squirms away from the skinheads and  retrieves his glasses. He hears Serafine call his name. H gets up amidst the mayhem and sees Serafine being carried away by the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone knocks into Andy and he falls to the ground. He g back on his feet - Serafine's nowhere in sight. He pushes his way through the crowd, looking for her. He catches si of her white dress in a distant corner. It's there for a  second and then gone again - apparently into a tunnel. He runs over to it. Andy peers into THE TUNNEL, which houses some old pipes. fades quickly into darkness. He grabs a kerosene torch fr the wall and runs into the tunnel. About a hundred yards he passes an ALCOVE. He leans in with his torch and peers around. The cave lik room is empty but something catches Andy's eye. Scratched into the stone wall, amidst various graffiti, is A PENTAG It looks to be centuries old. Andy's transfixed by it. The sound of his own breathing  suddenly becomes deafening and his vision begins to disto the textures of the stone wall begin to churn and crawl, the flames from his torch melt into different hues. The  pentagram glows and seems to grow out of the wall... The hallucinatory flash is over as fast as it began. Pant stunned, Andy shakes it off. He wipes his face, checking traces of paint. He tries to reassure himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman's SCREAM echoes through the tunnels. He runs towa it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another scream - anguished, tortured. Andy runs faster. H arrives at an intersection with another tunnel, turns the corner and finds... A decrepit old WINO hogging a bottle from his warty HAG  companion, provoking her to scream like she just lost her only son. They look up at Andy. The hag shuts up. They fi Andy with an odd stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... I, uh, did you see a girl,  la femme, um, avec, la dress blanc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just stare at him. Spooked, he walks past them. They follow him with their creepy stare as he continues into t tunnel, which slopes downhill. He comes to an old stairway leading down into darkness. W pours out of a hole in the ceiling. The steps are severel eroded and slick with flowing water and moss. Andy sees  something. It's SERAFINE'S SHOE, laying on a landing a fe yards down the stairs. He leans in further, loses his foo and slips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh! Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoots down the stairs on his back, past the shoe whic lies at the mouth of an intersecting tunnel. His glasses  come off. The torch goes out. He stops at the bottom of t stairs on a gravel surface. He winces a bit as he sits up. It's too dark to make much out. He feels around the gravel, finds his GLASSES - they shattered. He scowls. He stands up and walks ahead, feeli his way along the slick wall, peering into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERAFINE!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The echo sounds different - like he's in a larger space. echo decays into a familiar low RUMBLE. A reflection of light appears in a puddle on the floor. T light gets brighter until Andy sees the subway tracks at feet. The rumble gets suddenly louder as

dialogues.speaker: METRO TRAIN
dialogues.text: barrels around the corner, flooding the tunnel with light and closing on Andy fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and runs for THE STAIRWAY. He skids on the grave and overshoots it. He scrambles back and up into it just THE TRAIN whooshes past. Andy scurries a few feet up the slick steps, using a rust pipe for a handhold. As he looks back at the SPARKING, RU TRAIN WHEELS, his heart pounding in his head, he has anot HALLUCINATORY-FLASH: the sparks explode into streaking  patterns of color and light. It passes quickly. The train goes by and its rumble fades Andy squeezes his temples and takes a deep breath. Before finishes exhaling, an UNEARTHLY HOWL echoes through the  tunnels. The howl literally takes his breath away - he's  frozen there, eyes wide, not breathing for a long moment. Quietly, carefully, he makes his way back up the dark, we stairs. He comes to the landing, picks up Serafine's shoe and steps into the INTERSECTING TUNNEL. He squints into the darkness. Without his glasses, ANDY'S POV is a bit blurry. He walks into the tunnel. Another HOWL. Andy swallows har

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries along. WATER DRIPS from the tunnel ceiling, do the walls, onto the cobblestone floor, flowing into rivul around Andy's feet and joining a stream that flows ahead him, disappearing into the blackness ahead. He approaches another intersection. He stumbles over something. He looks down and makes out a GIRL'S BARE LEG lying in a  puddle in the dark intersecting tunnel. He follows the le up with his eyes - it's messily severed above the knee. H gasps. He looks further into the tunnel and sees A PAIR OF GLOWI YELLOW EYES staring back at him out of the darkness. Andy turns and runs. With a horrible ROAR, the eyes lunge after him and turn t corner. As it gains on Andy, we see the dim outline of th massive wolf-like beast. Andy dives for a SMALL CONDUIT, barely big enough for his body, and wriggles into it. Behind him the yellow eyes ap at the mouth of the conduit - the beast SNARLS but can't in. Andy can see a dim light at the end of the conduit. H crawls along. He emerges into ANOTHER TUNNEL. Some thirty yards away, l and street noise come through a GRATE on the ceiling of a antechamber beyond an iron gate.  Relieved, Andy starts o towards it. A SNARL stops him in his tracks. THE BEAST co tearing around a corner fifty yards behind him. Andy breaks into a sprint towards the antechamber. He sli on the wet floor and lands in a puddle, drenching himself The beast closes in. Andy gets up, runs into the antechamber and slams the iro gate shut. There's a rusty DEADBOLT lock on the gate, but key. The beast is twenty five yards away and closing fast it's massive silhouette filling the diameter of the tunne Andy whips out his SWISS ARMY KNIFE, opens the screw driv and tries it in the old-fashioned keyhole - it doesn't wo The beast is twenty feet away. Andy tries the can opener no luck. Ten feet. Andy jams the corkscrew into the hole. The beast leaps. The corkscrew turns. The DEADBOLT SLIDES SLAM!! The beast rams the gate, shaking the anteroom. But holds. Flashes of CLAWS and TEETH thrash through the bars but it's still too dark to make the beast out clearly. An runs across the anteroom, grabs the steel sewer grate on ceiling, and hoists himself up. Through the bars, he sees a BUSY BOULEVARD in the Pigalle (the "Times Square" of Paris). There's a COP a few paces  away. Andy screams to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELP! OFFICER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE BOULEVARD - Over the roar of traffic and midnight  revelers, the cop can barely pinpoint Andy's screams. He  looks around, confused. He sees Andy and angrily shakes h baton at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Hey! You shouldn't be down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOR GOD'S SAKES, LET ME OUT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BEAST slams the gate, wrenching one of the iron bars  loose - two more bars and it'll fit through. Andy jumps d picks up the loose bar. It's got a STAR SHAPED SPEAR TIP. He rushes at the gate and jams the spear through the gate aiming for the thrashing teeth and eyes in the darkness. The beast ducks and the spear sinks a couple of inches in the BACK OF IT'S NECK and stops, apparently on bone. It  recoils and ROARS with pain, shaking the spear free. ON THE STREET - The cop raps the bars with his nightstick and peers into the dark anteroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in French) You are not allowed down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE ANTEROOM - The beast rams the gate - it's rage  redoubled. Andy jumps up and grabs the grate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET ME THE FUCK OUT OF HERE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) "Fuck"? You think I don't know this  word "fuck"? Is that how you talk to  policemen in America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, the cop runs to his car, muttering to himself. H opens the trunk and rummages around for something. IN THE ANTEROOM - The beast knocks another bar off the ga Andy watches in horror as it rams even harder, loosening NEXT BAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cop) FUCK! FUCK! FUCK! FUCK! FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE STREET - The cop looks over at Andy, incensed. He  takes a crowbar from the trunk, runs back cussing in Fren and struggles with the grate. IN THE ANTEROOM - The NEXT BAR on the gate gives. The bea sticks its head through the gap and focuses it's searing  yellow eyes on Andy. It rears back, ready to pounce... THE GRATE - comes up. The cop grabs Andy and pulls... IN THE ANTEROOM - Andy's legs dangle like bait. The beast lunges, teeth and claws bared. ON THE STREET - Andy screams as a bus roars by. The cop p him up and out. Andy's right pants leg is torn open and h bleeding from a GOUGE in his ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Okay, what the hell are you up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bit me! My leg! Jesus, it's down  there, shoot it! Shoot it for Christ's  sakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points frantically at the open hole. The cop aims his  flashlight in the hole. It's empty. He looks Andy up and  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Your passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking, Andy takes his passport out of his pocket. The c takes it and copies some information. Andy raves at him - blur of English and broken French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something down there! A bear  or something! A god damn monster!  Beau coup teeth! Huge, Grande, with  yellow eyes, all this hair, it killed  Serafine! My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You on drugs? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he falters) No... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks disoriented, half-crazed. He definitely seems li he's on drugs. The cop shines his flashlight in Andy's ey his PUPILS are like saucers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop's flashlight sparks another HALLUCINATORY FLASH. cops face melts like liquid, sounds swirl together, the g neon signs of The Pigalle explode into streaking colors a we BURN INTO WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop car pulls to a stop. The cop gets out, opens the  back door, and pulls Andy out. He pushes Andy towards the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Stay off the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop gets in the car and drives away. Andy staggers to the gate in a daze and fumbles with the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy walks up to the apartment door. Disoriented and shak he manages to open the door and walk in. He locks the doo and switches on the lights. He looks out the small PEEPHO No sign of anyone or anything. He leans back against the  door and rubs his hands across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god. Je suis seriously messed  up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a DRIPPING sound coming from the kitchen. Andy lo across the living room into the dark kitchen. The DRIP  continues. He steps forward cautiously. Suddenly he feels something and looks down sharply. UNCLE TERRENCE, bloody stumps and all, is clutching Andy' legs and looking up at him desperately. He's trying to sp but can't seem to make a sound. Blood from his wounds soa the WHITE BEAR RUG beneath them. Andy's terror struck, he tries to jump away but falls  backwards to the floor. Terrence crawls up and gets close Andy's face. He croaks out two words in a rasp -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saint Severin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EKG monitor shows a FLATLINE. Alarms are BEEPING.  Terrence's body lies motionless under the oxygen tent. A  DOCTOR and a NURSE rush to the bed. The nurse rips the ox tent away and the doctor SLAMS his fists down on Terrence chest. The EKG show s a tentative blip. The doctor SLAMS  again. An erratic heart beat starts back up on the EKG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy lies passed out on the floor. Terrence is gone, and rug is free from blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel sits next to the patrol cop, PEROTIN, who rescued  Andy. They're hysterical with laughter. Even LeDuc, sitti behind his desk, is chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) What else did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Yellow eyes... big teeth... (he can barely choke  out the words between  laughs) Covered with hair! Ha-ha-ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perotin playfully growls at Marcel. They laugh even harde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Okay Perotin. You can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perotin nods, still laughing. Marcel walks him to the doo Before he steps out, Perotin bares his teeth, growls agai and cracks up some more. Marcel, laughing, claps him on t back and shuts the door - then he and LeDuc go instantly  stone faced. They look at each other gravely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) Okay. So maybe you were right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmph. At least now there's one person  around here who doesn't think I'm  crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc walks to a map of Paris on the wall covered with co push pins. He sticks a blue pin in it. He points to a gre pin on another part of the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Twelve thirty-six a.m. here. Twelve  forty a.m. here. There's two of them.  At least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc looks at his calendar. Four days are circled in red ink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Two more nights in this lunar cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double merde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc opens a tall cabinet, revealing a bookshelf stuffed with dusty tomes. He browses past dozens of titles about  black magic and demonology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better follow that McDermott  kid. He's going to wind up like his  uncle if he's not careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Little twerp thinks he's  Colombo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc selects an old book and hands it to Marcel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do some research, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel takes the book. He inspects the cover (it's in Fre "Werewolves through the Ages: from St. Severin to the  present".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Saint Severin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never heard the story of Saint  Severin driving the werewolves from  Paris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's what McDermott was  raving about in the ambulance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you think everyone's as ignorant  as you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc grunts, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector, you're not exactly typical.  I mean c'mon... (holds up book) This thing isn't sitting on a lot of  coffee tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SAME OLD BOOK, sitting on the coffee table. The pages are stuffed with notepaper place markers, many covered wi scribbling, and CHEMICAL NOTATION. In the background, on floor, is Andy - fast asleep and snoring where he collaps the night before. We hear a key in the lock. The door opens, smacking Andy the head once, twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aoww! Hey! What the hell...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the door so it can't hit him again. Serafine pok her head around and sees him. She's surprised, relieved,  elated. Andy's reaction is more disoriented, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy! Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels beside him and helps him sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God! What a relief! I thought...  After you disappeared... I couldn't  find you... I thought all sorts of  horrible things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Ditto. I saw, er, I thought  I saw you get munched... like Uncle  Terrence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at the clean bear rug. Andy rises to his fe groggily. He looks down at the rip in his pant leg. He fe the torn fabric, trying to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Did you cut yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... sort of... Maybe... It's all  kind of blurry. We met at the club,  then... Damn, that was some weird  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes over to the window and parts the curtains. It's a brilliant sunny day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fucking stupid, going down  there. You could have been killed. I  tried to warn you, But you don't  listen. Just like your uncle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's only half listening. He opens the window, and inha deeply. Across the court yard, a MATRONLY WOMAN leans out window, hanging her laundry. In the courtyard, Lulu the  obnoxious poodle YAPS at another resident, and Madame Chr calls her back. Andy's head is clearing. His mood lifting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be a hero. All Americans  think they are cowboys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning out window) I was an Indian, actually. Man, that  damn psycho paint...! If that's  supposed to be mild, I don't want to  know about medium. (he looks at the woman  and smiles, the sun  on his face. To  himself:) The planet earth. It's good to be  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... you feel okay now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around and smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Actually, I feel fan-fucking- tastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine laughs. She hasn't heard this expression before. approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fan-fucking-tastic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what more could I want? I  survived my first and last  hallucinogenic hellride, and neither  of us is dead. I'd say I feel almost  as great as you look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a grab for her, and she pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps up on the sofa, unable to contain his energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Serafine. Let's go out. Show  me the real Paris, the part that  isn't overpriced and overrun with  German tourists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to Jim Morrison's grave at Pere  Lachaise. It's overrun with American  tourists. I have to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! Let's go hock loogies off  the Eiffel Tower!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She digs in her pockets and hands him some coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. You go. "Hock some loogies"  for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and heads off to the office. He runs in front o her and blocks her path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about food? Even beautiful women  have to eat. It's true. I read it.  Please? A half an hour? (pause. He sees she's  tempted) My treat? (she's smiling. He  resorts to begging) Pleez! Don't make go out there alone  again! I'm begging you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But I'm back in half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy claps his hands together in triumph and scrambles to hold open the door for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I can see fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gestures to his filthy clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man! Our first date and already you're  trying to get me to change! You French  women work quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and pushes him back in the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY LEWIS
dialogues.text: on a TV screen, dubbed with a zany French voice, undergoe radical physical transformation in "The Nutty Professor". Pull back to reveal Andy and Serafine watching this scene a dozen or so TV's in a store window display. Several PAR PEDESTRIANS watch Jerry with reverence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is Paris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen, the Nutty Professor's alter ego, "Buddy Love"  launches into his swinging version of "That Old Black Mag To this accompaniment, we cut the following -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - AT A BRASSERIE: Andy is about to escort Serafine into t trendy eatery, but she stops him at the door and points t the menu, or more specifically the prices. He makes a  horrified face, and they move on. - IN A BOULANGERIE: Serafine buys cheese, Andy buys meats the counterman shows Andy how big a slice off the pate lo he's about to cut. Andy nods "yes". The counterman cuts i and offers the slice. Andy shakes his head "no" and point to the much larger remainder of the loaf. - AT AN OUTDOOR MARKET: Detective Marcel, wearing a lame  "disguise" (new wave sunglasses ala "Diva"), watches Andy and Serafine shop from a distance. - IN A PATISSERIE: Andy points to a large baguette, says  something suggestive and winks boastfully at Serafine. Sh gives him a "yeah, right" look and points at a small  breadstick. - IN A WINE STORE: Andy looks at each bottle closely, the "tests" it by shaking vigorously. Serafine's amused. The  owner's baffled. - ON THE RIGHT BANK: Arms full of groceries, Andy and Ser pass the row of outdoor pet stores near the river. Andy l longingly at the live ducks in their cages. Serafine pull him along. MUSIC fades out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Serafine sit on the river bank facing a magnific Paris vista. Serafine unpacks the food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! You bought enough pate for a  fucking army!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me, exactly which truck driver  did you study English with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs and pushes him playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I should talk. Monsieur foot-in- the-mouth. I'm really sorry about  that whole Woody Allen thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's Woody Allen. (Andy laughs. She  starts uncorking the  wine.) No, your uncle really helped me. I  was sort of messed up for a while.  Wasting my time just partying and...  just stupid shit. He kind of woke me  up, gave me a job, got me taking  classes. (she uncorks the wine  and fills their  plastic cups) You know, he and Claude, their work  is controversial, but they're serious  about it. Totally dedicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what counts. If you're not  passionate about it, don't waste  your time. That's why I quit  college... Plus I'm a lazy bastard. (They raise their  cups. Andy taps his  forehead.) Wait, I know this... A votre sante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A la votre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They "clink" and drink. He notices her KEYCHAIN lying on ground. It's a miniature replica of Rodin's famous sculpt "The Kiss". He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks familiar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, Rodin. Mmm! He's the fuc- (she catches herself  and laughs) I mean, he's the best. You must go  to the Rodin sculpture garden, in  the huitieme, it's so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gestures across the river. Andy looks at the gorgeous panorama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I gotta admit, you French are  pretty good at beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Serafine. She looks back at him. He holds up  "The Kiss".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you're pretty good at this  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, sculpting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head "no" and moves towards her. They kiss  tenderly. They separate and share a deep, passionate look They kiss again, hungrily, falling into a passionate embr They're really going for it. Her NAILS dig into his back. pulls her body into his until they look like one form - j like Rodin's sculpture. APPLAUSE and CHEERS break the moment. A TOURIST BOAT is  gliding by on the Seine, it's ELDERLY PASSENGERS applaudi the young couple. Serafine pulls away, blushing a little, and turns to the boat. ANDY doesn't even notice the boat. He's staring at Sera fine with a scary kind of intensity. She starts to say something but he starts kissing her aga cutting her off. Suddenly he's out of control, pawing at her... It takes a effort for her to pull back from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, calm down a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks into his eyes and freezes with fear. HIS STARE terrifying, totally predatory, inhuman. Something's ignit in him. She pushes him away and shakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy blinks and seems to come a couple of steps back to  normality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Aren't I a good kisser? What's  the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fixes him with a heavy, suspicious stare. She glances down at his ankle, where the bottom of HIS WOUND is visib She seems to understand something. She fumbles in her pur takes out a compact mirror, and checks her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
