dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so hard. I used to think  about it all the time. Maybe you  should meet my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy buries his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. Cut him loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't! At midnight tonight, he  will kill again. It's crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? We have nothing. Let  him go, then watch him. If you're  right, you can pick him up at  midnight. Or maybe he'll lead you to  the others. Just let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chief leaves. LeDuc scowls. He looks in at Andy, stil gesticulating wildly and talking to thin air. LeDuc reent the room and looks at Andy bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're free to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks from LeDuc to the drawers and back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc gives him an angry stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy walks past Notre Dame, flanked by Marcel and Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging is nice. Never goes out of  style. What about hare-kare - a taste  of the Orient? But no! You're in  Paris! Try the Guillotine! There's  one in the Louvre!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd use pills. They're painless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh give me a break! He could use  pills back in America! Why not get a  little culture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy stops in his tracks - overwhelmed, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I didn't mean to hurt anybody...  God, I didn't mean to... to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rip my face off? Hey, we all make  mistakes. Hell, I didn't mean to  sleep with you on the first night,  especially without a condom. But I  did, and now I'm paying the price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy slumps over, beaten. Amy puts her arm around him. Ma pats him on the back. They start him walking along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's face it. It's a, how do you  say... mother-fucker. But we're all  in it together. That's why we're  trying to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOOOOONNNNK!! Andy looks up to see a speeding bus about t flatten him. Amy and Marcel have lead him into traffic. H jumps back and the bus just grazes him. Of course, it pas right through Amy and Marcel. They're still standing ther when it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde! Just missed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andy) Uhh! Would you die already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's adrenaline is pumping. There's still some fight in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! If I'm gonna kill myself  I'll do it when I'm good and ready!  You can go to hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we can't. That's the problem. God  knows it would beat hanging around  with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy socks Marcel and breaks his jaw - off. It skitters o into the street. He punches him in the gut - SKLURCH! His fist gets stuck in the tangle of Marcel's abdominal organ While Andy tries to pull his hand free, Amy rears back an kicks him in the balls. He wrenches his hand loose and  staggers back, clutching his groin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you can't kick me! You're an  apparition!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, all of a sudden you got a degree  in supernatural law?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel fits his jaw back into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it the power of suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He socks Andy in the mouth. Andy shakes it off, rips Marc arm off, bashes him in the face with it, then turns aroun and uses it to beat Amy over the head. Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: IN AN UNMARKED POLICE CAR PARKED A HALF BLOCK AWAY
dialogues.text: RENE and FRANCOIS, the two cops who accompanied LeDuc to  Andy's apartment, watch Andy whirl around the sidewalk,  swinging wildly at the air, reacting to invisible blows, cursing unseen enemies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) You know, in his own way, he's  probably happier than any of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francois nods philosophically. Meanwhile, back in Andy's  reality... Marcel has got him in a full Nelson and Amy is punching h in the stomach. He bucks forward, wrenching both of Marce arms off and slams them together onto Amy's head, knockin her down. Andy waves Marcel's arms in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha-ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, big man. You can beat up a couple  of cadavers. Well let me make  something real clear, asshole. If  you don't kill yourself, at midnight  tonight you're gonna transform and  murder innocent people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to be, McDermott?  A coward and a murderer? Or a man,  with guts enough to do the right  thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth of this question hits home with Andy. A heavy  expression falls over his face, one of grave sadness, but also inner dignity. He breathes deeply and exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Let me write a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man. Now can I have my arms  back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music cue: Thelonius Monk's "Round Midnight". The NEWS ST MAN hands Andy some stamps. Andy sticks them on a letter  addressed to Mr. and Mrs. William McDermott. He starts wa away but a postcard in the display rack catches his eye - it's Rodin's " The Kiss". He looks at it sadly.

dialogues.speaker: A MAILBOX
dialogues.text: Andy drops the letter in the box. He walks to a pay phone the sidewalk. Amy and Marcel lean on a nearby building,  watching Andy dial. Terrence's answering machine picks up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Hey. This is Terrence. Please leave  a message at the beep... (English) In other words, this is Terrence  McDermott. Please leave a message. (it BEEPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Serafine, I hope you're checking  these. It's Andy. So I guess you  knew what was wrong with me yesterday.  Unfortunately it took me until today  to realize it, and because of that  two people are dead. If you didn't  know, well, shit, it's irrelevant  now. I know what I have to do, but  before I do it I just wanted to say...  I don't know what would've happened  with us, but I'm really glad I had  the chance to know you even if it  was only a couple of days and... I  don't know... I probably wouldn't  have the nerve to say this if I was  gonna see you again, but I think if  I had the chance to kiss you one  more time I would've fallen totally  in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, Serafine enters and runs to the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well... Bye Serafine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine snatches the phone off the receiver just as Andy hangs up. She gets a dial tone. She's very upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SIDEWALK
dialogues.text: Amy and Marcel watch Andy hang up in the phone booth. The emotion of the moment is getting to Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, I feel bad for him. Maybe we  should've told him abou -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy!? You know that's  totally impractical. Besides, like  the Bible says... (he sticks his finger  in her empty eye  socket) An eye for an eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy nods. Andy exits the phone booth and approaches them. "Round Midnight" fades out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy drains the last of a bottle of Jack Daniel's and wob along, totally smashed and a bit wistful, with Amy and Ma in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, lots of my heroes  killed themselves. Hemingway, Van  Gogh... um... Herve Villachaise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is class kid, all the way.  What a way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got style, babe. That's why I  went for you in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're approaching the Eiffel tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they ask how I died, just tell  'em... Ei-ffel.

dialogues.speaker: THE COPS
dialogues.text: sit in their car, watching Andy buy his ticket and get in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Should we follow him up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's gotta come down some time.  Fuck it, let's grab a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a typical Parisian bakery, stuffed to the ceiling wi an unbelievable array of the finest, most delectable past Rene steps to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vous avez les doughnuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at the elevator doors. They open. Andy stri out onto the deck, through the milling TOURISTS, flanked Marcel and Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one thing certain in  life - each of us owes God a death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proud, determined, Andy arrives at the six foot wire mesh fence and quickly scales it. Amy and Marcel follow. Nearb tourists are alarmed and a clamor of concern rises up. Th with camcorders jockey for position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we can do is make sure it's a  good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy gets over the fence and stands on the small ledge. A and Marcel join him. The tourists gasp. Andy glances down THE PRECIPITOUS DROP. He turns suddenly pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I feel sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. In a few seconds you  won't feel a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puking on yourself in midair is not  a good death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the more you think about it,  the harder it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like sex with my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key is don't look down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also like sex with my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marcel) Would you shut up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks woozy. Tourists are trying to dissuade him in  Italian, Japanese, Icelandic, etc. Marcel tries a new tac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, we'll jump together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up Marcel's  lead) Sure. We wouldn't ask you to do  anything we wouldn't do. Now give me  your hand... that's it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy coaxes Andy's hand off the fence. The crowd gasps. An grits his teeth and focuses again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... two... three... JUMP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jump, but Andy stops short - GASTON is leaning over fence and has Andy by his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not getting off so easy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY AND MARCEL
dialogues.text: Plummet through the air. They look back at Andy, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde! I can't believe this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try to be a good sport, and look  what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLAT!! Their bodies split into several pieces and squirt out on the pavement into two radial patterns, each about feet in diameter. Repair will take a while this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Galileo was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: has Andy by the arm and is trying to pull up to "safety". The tourists cheer him on. Andy is resisting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the ADM? Where did your uncle  put it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I don't know what the fuck you're  talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Your uncle told you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle's in a coma you moron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the coma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't tell me anything. All he  said was Saint Severin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy swallows the word "Severin", remembering something a he speaks. Suddenly wheels are turning in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saint Severin? The church? So you  know all about the ADM! (Andy reacts to the  word "church?") Where is it! Tell me! Tell me or  else!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or else what? You'll kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I'll kill your fucking  girlfriend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy pulls backward as hard as he can, jerking Gaston off balance. He's trying to pull them both to their deaths, b Gaston grabs a STEEL POST with his free hand. Andy hangs below the ledge, pulling Gaston's arm down wit all his new superhuman strength. But Gaston pulls back ju as hard. Andy sees The STEEL POST start to bend. He looks into Gaston's FERAL STARE and understands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you! You son-of-a-bitch! You  got my uncle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POST keeps bending - its welds won't hold long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be an idiot! I'm not the only  one. If I die, Serafine dies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! You're bluffing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you think Claude hangs out  underground cause he likes to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gives Andy pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you call me a moron...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy stops pulling. He looks uncertain - maybe Gaston is  right... But then - SNAP! The post, which has bent all th way over into a "J" shape, snaps its weld. Gaston and And plummet towards the ground nine hundred feet below. The  tourists gasp. Using the bent pole as a hook, Gaston snares a HORIZONTAL ANTENNA which sticks out of the tower about fifty feet un the observation deck. He stops short and dangles there, s gripping Andy by the arm. The tourists CHEER. Meanwhile,  nine hundred feet below...

dialogues.speaker: RENE AND FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: lean on their car, munching doughnuts. The tower looms be them, and we can just make out the dangling figures at th top. Rene reaches into the paper doughnut bag and comes u short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Oh! You ate the last jelly!

dialogues.speaker: UP ON THE ANTENNA
dialogues.text: Gaston's grip is firm. They'll have to climb up the iron  cross beams to the observation deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ADM. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Just gimme a minute to  freshen up.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OBSERVATION DECK
dialogues.text: Andy and Gaston climb up onto the deck. The tourists appl and cheer for Gaston - the "hero".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo! Magnifique! Wunderbah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston can't resist posing as the cameras flash - he suck in his cheeks, purses his lips and does his best "Mickey  Rourke". Andy looks at him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be in Paris. Even the  werewolves are poseurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston and Andy endure the elevator ride together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, if you and the nutty professor  are both werewolves, what do you  want with drugs? You like seeing  lots of pretty colors when you're  tearing people's throats out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you know about the church, why  ask such stupid questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step out of the elevator and up to the apartment doo Andy takes his key ring out and tries the lock. The key w turn. Andy jiggles it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries another key. It doesn't work. He jiggles it, rat the door on its hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm new here, what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy tries a third key. No good. More jiggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking cretin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fourth key works. Andy pushes the door open. Gaston s him in roughly and steps in after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston shuts the door behind him and walks over to Andy, scans the room nervously, unsure of his next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's eyes come to rest on the end table drawer, where  Serafine had put the gun before... He advances toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patronizing) Okay, okay. I got your magic medicine  right here, dogboy. Just -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston grabs Andy's hand before he opens the drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm an idiot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat... incredulous) Sure. Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves Andy away and opens the drawer... no gun. They  hear a pistol COCK behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston turns and sees Serafine aiming the gun at him. Wit incredible speed he leaps for the window as Serafine fire BANG!! The bullet catches him in the arm as he dives thro the glass. BANG!! She fires again and misses. Gaston lands in the courtyard, three stories below, and r off with a slight limp. BANG! BANG! Serafine fires blindl into the courtyard after him, overwrought with anger. And puts a hand to her arm, and she lowers the gun. They embr tightly, desperately. Serafine can't keep from crying. An comforts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey... shhh. It's okay now...  La Femme Nikita strikes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wipes away her tears and she smiles at his joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, I thought... I heard your  message and... thank God you're  alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She embraces him again, but Andy gently frees himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not alright. We both know that.  The only reason I'm here now is to  warn you. You're still in danger.  Gaston told me that Claude has got  the curse too. He's a werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. He told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! He told you? When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy hears a familiar voice behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy spins around to see Claude standing by the hallway t Terrence's office. Andy reaches for the gun and points it him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two faced bastard. I knew you  were full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts herself between Claude and the gun barrel. Andy  pushes her out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine! Move! Don't you see, he's  just after the drug, that ADM stuff.  He's using you to get to it, just  like he used Uncle Terrence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude approaches Andy, speaking calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're exactly right, Andy. I enlisted  both Serafine and your uncle to obtain  ADM. And now I'm counting on your  assistance too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, Andy. It's a cure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cure. With ADM we can wipe out  lycanthropy, the curse of the  werewolf, forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is shocked, stunned, skeptical. He bluffs with the o card he's got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so? Maybe we should go to  Saint Severin church and make sure,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude's face changes. He's surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, you've done your homework...  Excellent. Get your coat. Leave the  gun with Serafine. She can keep  searching. We don't have much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Serafine share a heavy look. He hands her the gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy... I should never have let you  go underground. I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I had to be a damn Hemingway hero.  Well I'll tell ya, the old man and  the sea didn't go through half this  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheets of rain crash down over this ancient gothic church Sharing an umbrella, Andy and Claude walk inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked across the street, Rene and Francois watch them en the church. Rene talks into a cellular phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) He's going into Saint Severin church  with Professor Claude Roussel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Really... Okay, keep checking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc hangs up and thinks a moment. He turns the page of old book on his desk, revealing an old woodcut illustrati of a policeman being attacked by a werewolf. He frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An evening mass is in progress. The boy's choir fills the church with a solemn hymn. Andy follows Claude to a narro staircase. An OLD WOMAN gives them the evil eye and cross herself as they pass. Claude and Andy go up the stairs an arrive at a balcony under a magnificent wall of ancient  STAINED GLASS. One of the panels catches Andy's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PANEL shows a weird medieval ritual - a man draining  blood from another man's neck into a goblet. ANOTHER PANE features a pentagram. ANOTHER PANEL shows a huge werewolf eating a monk under a frowning sun. All the transcription are in Latin. Claude signals Andy to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The panels that concern us are over  here. (he directs Andy to a  group of panels) I'll translate the Latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PANEL shows a different werewolf, tied down, being stab in the heart by a knight under a frowning moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Then Simon did slay the demon spirit,  the same as had made him unclean,"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE NEXT PANEL - the knight now holds the beast's heart a impaled on his dagger. Where the beast was, a man lies  bleeding in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "and Simon did cut out the heart of  the beast which once dead, regained  the shape of a man"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE NEXT PANEL shows the beast's heart on a platter. The  Hero is sitting at a table, cutting into the heart with a knife, as if he's about to eat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Simon ate of the heart of the beast  and his soul was cleansed." (he turns to Andy) These pictures are not just myth,  Andy. The scholars of the day used  them to record facts and enlighten  the public. This is the medieval  version of a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Yeah, well what if it's the Weekly  World News...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's all true, Andy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Andy turns to see Amy and Marcel, a little wors for wear, standing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, if by some miracle you can  find the werewolf that bit you, and  then manage to eat it's heart, the  curse is lifted. I was gonna tell  you but Marcel wouldn't let me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sure, it was all mean old Marcel's  idea. Give me a break! We didn't  tell you because it's a wild goose  chase! Not to mention disgusting.  Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel reaches into his own chest cavity, rips out his ow slimy purple heart, and thrusts it in Andy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little Grey Poupon and then Bon  appetite, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy grimaces and turns back to Claude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Amy) I don't believe we've been introduced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?... Oh, right, you can see these  guys too. Jesus... (he rolls his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles and extends  her hand) Amy. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude shakes her hand - SQUISH. Some sort of body fluid  oozes out of Amy's hand. Claude frowns and discreetly wip his hand with a handkerchief. Marcel smiles and extends h hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcel. (Claude smiles  politely, declining  Marcel's rotting  hand) My wife has all your books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude nods "thank you". Andy's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Later on we'll have to get  together for cocktails. Right now I  kinda have to hurry before I grow a  lot of hair and eat people. (to Claude) Say this heart thing works. What's  it got to do with ADM?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's chemistry, Andy. Nothing more.  Mutated antigens concentrated in the  heart of the infector unlock a vaccine- like chain reaction in the infectee.  There were not many bio-chemists  working in the twelfth century, but  with today's technology it's possible  to synthesize any chemical imaginable.  When I discovered this ancient cure  I knew who to go to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Terrence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I was able to decode the old  texts and give Terrence the  specifications. It took a lot of  trial and error, but finally he got  it: Adenine Di-Methyloxide. ADM. I  call it ADAM. But just before he was  attacked, he hid it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Gaston was after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that sociopath. He's given  himself over to the evil of  lycanthropy. To him, ADAM is just a  threat to the terror he holds over  others. To us, it's salvation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I don't know much about  chemistry, but even if this stuff  works, you better find it by midnight.  Otherwise it's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. Back to the Eiffel  Tower. (to Claude) And what about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I won't go through another  night of that hell. I have my  contingency plan right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes a WHITE PILL from his coat pocket and holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sodium cyanide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHURCH BELLS ring. The group listens tensely as the s bells sound eight times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock. Shit. You'd think my  uncle would have left a clue, a note,  something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Serafine is searching  for. Without much luck, I'm afraid.  If only we could speak with him. But  alas, he's off in another realm,  close to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels in Andy's head are turning. He looks over at A and Marcel. He smiles. He's got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, please. Don't smile like that.  You're scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Serafine walk down the corridor of the Terminal  Ward. Andy looks determined. Serafine looks upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure this will  work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. He already tried to  contact me once. If you saw his  face... He was desperate to tell me  something. I owe him this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, either he wastes away as a  pathetic vegetable or he can give  what's left of his life to save  hundreds of potential victims. He's  a McDermott. I know what his choice  would be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose you're right. But I still  don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop at the door to Terrence's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. You don't have to watch. Stay  out here and stand guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Andy goes into

Andy approaches Terrence's oxygen ten In the dim light, he can barely make out Terrence through the plastic, lying motionless, barely making an impressio under the sheets. He looks at the body wistfully and surv the array of machinery that's keeping him "alive". Most o the machines are plugged into a TRANSFORMER BOX on the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. We meet again... Look, I know  you understand what I'm about to do  here. I think. But I hope you forgive  me anyway.

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE'S ROOM
dialogues.text: The old man is lying back down, asleep. He seems to be ok His support machinery is functioning normally again. With a sigh of relief, Andy turns and pulls back the curt behind him. There's Terrence, sans oxygen tent, hooked up another extensive support system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. You moved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the curtain closed behind him, and moves in clos to his uncle. Terrence's expression looks unmistakably mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look happy... Um, I don't  usually go in for this stuff, but... (He crosses himself,  and says a silent  prayer) Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy leans down, opens the transformer box, and flips the power switch. The machines power down - all except the EK monitor, which shows a flat line and emits the familiar s tone. Andy switches off the monitor. Silence. Terrence's body is completely still, peaceful. He leans d over its face and speaks in a soft voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Terrence? Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrence's body remains motionless.

dialogues.text: This time the nurse doesn't wait to respond. Seeing the  indicators from Terrence's room, she presses the intercom

dialogues.text: Silence. Andy's worried. He takes his uncle by the should

dialogues.text: Come on... Skip the undead orientation  and get down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He looks at the door nervously.

dialogues.text: Serafine sees a squad of doctors and nurses pushing troll of emergency equipment her way from the far end of the ha She leans her head in the door to warn Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is beside himself with stress. He shakes Terrence's a little to rouse him. Nothing. He tries a little harder  shake... The door opens. It's Serafine, also in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. What have I done? (to Serafine) Stall them! I'll meet you out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts the door, just in time. The emergency team are  right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning hysterics) Stay away from him! You butchers!  Haven't you done enough already!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They struggle to get past her.

dialogues.text: Andy can hear Serafine arguing outside the door. He looks out the window to the three story drop into the alley bel

dialogues.text: Andy rushes to the door and pushes it shut. He cranks the DOORKNOB all the over and bends it down, jamming it in th locked position. He steps away. The door holds, but for h long? He shrugs  apologetically, then takes a deep breath, closes his eyes and jumps.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE HOSPITAL ROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: The fat nurse is getting impatient with the doctors, who attempting to pick the lock "surgically". She pushes them aside and heaves her considerable heft against into the d It opens a crack. She backs up and slams it again...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The nurse's jolts shake the old guy's bed, sliding it for He dozes happily like a baby rocking in the cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy runs behind a nearby dumpster to avoid being seen fr the window above. He kicks the wall in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice calls out from behind Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! What an outrageous nightmare!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy spins around and sees Terrence, the undead version,  perched atop some trash bags, scratching himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Terrence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy? Andy is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Look, uncle Terrence -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrence mutters distractedly, excitedly, and quickly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, I have to tell you about the  dream I had - or that I'm still having -  it feels like a systemic, physio- tropic reaction to some drug, maybe  a triptamine or phenethylamine  derivative. But it is hyper-real.  I'd swear my legs had been cut off  or... wait a second... I'm getting a  strange meta-physical buzz. Shit.  I'm, uh, dead, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of...

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE HOSPITAL ROOM
dialogues.text: The doctors have clustered around Terrence's corpse. The  nurse is lubricating the electro-shock paddles for the do Serafine slips out the door into the hallway. SOMEONE'S POV, spying from behind a supply cart in the ha (we see a hand on the cart), watches Serafine walk away,  unnoticed by the doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undead. Right. Sort of an ectocosmic  manifestation. What a pisser. Tell  you one thing though, Timothy Leary  will be jealous as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, but listen, I need to know  where you hid the ADM?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ADM! Be careful, Andy. It's very  powerful. How do you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to St. Severin church. (Terrence reacts "I  see...") Now look -

dialogues.speaker: IN TERRENCE'S ROOM
dialogues.text: ZAP! The doctor jolts Terrence's chest with the paddles.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: Terrence's zombie jerks with sudden pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! No! Andy, don't let them  take me back there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ADM! Quickly! Where is it?!

dialogues.speaker: TERRENCE'S ROOM
dialogues.text: ZZT! They zap him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it! Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHH!! The wine cellar!! In a bottle  of Chateau Margaux. A metal  cylinder... Don't... Don't - AAAAH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another zap. The undead Terrence twists his face in pain. the background, Serafine appears at the mouth of the alle Terrence croaks out a few last words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies! All lies! Ahhhh!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy turns towards Serafine, then back to his uncle, but  Terrence is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrence's face is contorted with pain. The EKG monitor s a weak but regular heartbeat. The doctor pulls off his ma and wipes his brow. The other technicians congratulate hi

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: Serafine approaches. Andy runs up to join her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him. Just before those bastards  zapped him back. The ADM is in the  wine cellar, in a bottle of Chateau  Margaux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know he had a wine cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess that's why he hid it there.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run out of the alley and see GASTON jump on his hopp up Kawasaki enduro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit! He must have heard us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston sees them, gives them the finger and tears off dow the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run to Serafine's Vespa - the tires are slashed. Enr she kicks it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bastard! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks around desperately. A GUY pulls his motorcycle out of its parking spot and starts up the street towards  Andy. Andy jumps out in front of the accelerating bike an grabs the handlebars, stopping it short, sending the ride tumbling forward, over Andy. He lands on his butt in the  street and starts yelling at Andy, who climbs on the bike

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... I'll bring it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine hops on the back and they burn rubber down the s after Gaston. Music cue: CCR's "Bad Moon on the Rise". Th screech around the corner onto

dialogues.speaker: SAINT GERMAIN BOULEVARD
dialogues.text: It's red lights as far as the eye can see. Andy grits his teeth and accelerates towards the cluster of traffic stop at the first light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh merde!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts her eyes as Andy zooms between the rows of stop cars and roars through the red light. SCREECH!! Crossing  cars slam on their brakes and swerve to avoid the speedin bike. Andy bears down on the next red light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Hemingway, there was Starsky  and Hutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy speeds through more stopped cars and runs the next r light. SCREECH!! More swerving cars. Andy has to swerve  himself to avoid one. He bears down on the next light.  Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: is stopped on his bike, casually talking on a cellular ph two red lights ahead of Andy and Serafine. He hears their bike and turns to see them zoom through the intersection back of him. Gaston curses, puts the phone in his pocket twists his throttle, accelerating through the red light.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY AND SERAFINE
dialogues.text: gain on Gaston. They're seventy five yards behind him.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: pulls a pistol and aims over his shoulder. BANG! He fires back at them.

dialogues.speaker: SERAFINE
dialogues.text: pulls her pistol out. Both bikes roar through another red light. A POLICE CAR pulls out onto the boulevard and turns on it flashing lights and siren and pursues the bikes. The traf lights turn green. Gaston leads by fifty yards. The cop car pulls alongside  Andy and Serafine. She discreetly pockets her gun. The CO in the passenger seat aims his gun at Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Pull over! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no choice. They pull over. GASTON speeds safely a looking back at them and laughing. The cop car stops ahea of them and the COPS get out, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Hands in the air! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Serafine put up their hands. The first cop goes  back to check the police radio, which is beeping. The sec cop keeps his gun aimed at Andy's head. He's furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Hot shot huh? You know how many  officers die in high speed chases?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Moron! The guy ahead of us has a  gun! He's the one you should stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! I don't need you to tell me  my job. It's always "the other guy"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to kill people you ignorant  shithead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! That's it! You're under arrest!  Maybe you'll learn some respect in  jail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine curses again. Andy tries to calm her down. The  arguing escalates... In the car, the first cop is talking the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns, looks out his window and sees

dialogues.speaker: RENE AND FRANCOIS
dialogues.text: parked in their unmarked car. Rene is talking with him on the radio. Francois waves.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND COP
dialogues.text: is trying to put handcuffs on Serafine. She's still screa at him. He's incensed. The first cop gets out of the car walks up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andy and Serafine) You can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His partner looks at him, incredulous, red-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French - to first  cop) WHAT!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores 2nd cop) Drive safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine smiles at the second cop. Andy peels out, races  through the red light and disappears down the boulevard. cops watch them go, then turn to each other. The second c is apoplectic - about to explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rene and Francois speed off to keep pace with Andy. Rene dialing his cellular phone. As they pass the other police car, we glimpse the two cops in an angry shoving match ag the car. Rene's call goes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French - into phone) Hello. (Pause) I'll meet you there in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: arrive in front of the apartment and hop off their bike.  Serafine eyes GASTON'S BIKE hatefully. Andy pulls her alo

dialogues.text: Wait a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out her gun. BLAM! BLAM! She blasts the gas tan WOOF! The bike goes up in a fireball. Serafine nods,  satisfied. Andy looks at her like she's nuts. They rush i the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: throws another bottle. SMASH! Just wine. The floor is awa in the pricey Burgundy. He throws another bottle. SMASH!  Nothing. He licks his fingers. He's enjoying this...

dialogues.speaker: SERAFINE AND ANDY
dialogues.text: In the elevator, going down, maddeningly slowly. Through window they can see the full moon in the sky. Andy checks his watch. They look at each other nervously.

dialogues.speaker: GASTON
dialogues.text: Throws another - SMASH! A small METAL CYLINDER clinks as bounces on the floor. Gaston picks it up and smiles. BANG gunshot hits Gaston in the arm - he drops the cylinder.  Serafine and Andy stand in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirty bastard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine fires again - BANG! The shot misses as Gaston hi the deck and draws his gun in one very fast motion, takin aim at Andy who's rushing towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's far enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy stops, Gaston's gun aimed at his chest. Serafine ste slowly towards Gaston, her gun aimed at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Serafine) Another step and he's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead Serafine. Blow him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine stops. The three of them stand there in a close  triangle, the metal cylinder on the floor between them. I a Mexican standoff... in Paris. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude is in the doorway holding a pistol. Serafine sees and turns back to Gaston, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gaston) You heard him. Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston just smiles back at her. Claude steps forwards and cocks his gun against Serafine's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said drop the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine's expression turns confused, horrified. Andy is  shocked. She drops the gun. Claude picks it up and pocket it, keeping his gun on Serafine, who stares at him, aghas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard! God! I should've known.  You wanted the cure all for yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cure!? Ha-ha-ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Serafine react with confusion to Gaston's outbur Claude picks up the metal cylinder and unscrews its cap w his free hand. He slides out a vial filled with amber flu and holds it to up to the light. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's no cure. It's something  much more interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking liar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with mock alarm) Oh, did I hurt the little girl's  feelings? Well excusez moi... I  confess my desire for ADM is quite  "intense". So I deceived you and our  poor friend Terry - a competent  technician, but let's face it, a bit  naive. "The great cure for  lycanthropy!" Hmph. He didn't have  the vision to grasp the potential of  ADAM, until it was too late. And  even then, he came rushing down to  tell me, as if I would be just as  shocked! Ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pockets the vial, pulls out the white "cyanide" tablet and pops it in his mouth. Andy reacts with shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Andy's look,  crunching up tablet  in his mouth) Oh this? Rolaids. I had a midnight  snack that... disagreed with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine's been doing a slow burn. She explodes and lunge at Claude, knocking his gun out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking traitor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks Claude up and hurls him across the room. CRASH! Claude smashes into a rack of wine bottles. Serafine jump after him and dives on top of him pummeling him in a blin rage. Andy looks at her, agog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Gaston notice Claude's gun at the same time. They  both dive for it. Andy grabs it but Gaston steps on his h and aims his gun down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to be cured?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cocks the gun. Andy lets go of Claude's gun. Gaston pi it up and aims one gun at Andy and the other at Serafine, who's wrestling with Claude. Claude throws her off and sh lands on her butt next to Andy. Andy looks at Serafine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck!? You too!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammering) I... I didn't think you would... I'm  sorry... I believed that son-of-a- bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude gets to his feet, drenched with wine and smarting  from Serafine's punches. He walks over to Serafine and ki her in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, you foul mouthed little  cunt. I don't have time for your  histrionics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the ADM old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston is aiming one of his guns at Claude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for Christ's sakes Gaston. Can't  you rise above the level of common  thug just this once?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be an idiot. There are certain  procedures one must -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude sighs. He takes the vial from his pocket and walks over to Gaston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston grabs the vial, uncaps it and drinks it down greed He stands there, waiting. Nothing happens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha. Some wonder drug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't it doing anything!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. It's not ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude turns to the noise of footsteps and a walkie-talki in the hallway. Four uniformed officers plus Rene and Fra storm into the room, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French/English) Freeze! Drop your weapons! Hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Serafine put up their hands. Gaston brandishes h guns at the cops, then sees the six guns aimed at him and drops it. LeDuc walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French - to LeDuc) Thank God! These hoodlums tried to  rob me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French - to Claude) Put up your hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) But surely -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc cocks his pistol and aims it at Claude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude puts his hands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) What's the charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) There is no charge. (English) Everybody comes in for a few  questions. Everything checks out,  you will go free. After midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude frowns. Gaston swears. Andy looks at Serafine, sho and confused. She looks back at him, angry and sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are herding the handcuffed "questionees" into th back of a reinforced paddy wagon. LeDuc talks to the DRIV and another COP in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Godard is waiting for you at Rocherout  jail. Hurry... And don't stop for  anything. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver nods. It roars off, lights flashing and siren  wailing. LeDuc and the other cops head for their respecti cars. LeDuc barks orders to an AID who's at the ready wit the car radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want four separate maximum security  cells ready. Get video cameras,  photographers, and doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aid nods and gets on the radio. LeDuc checks his watc It's 10:47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine hangs her head sullenly, in a quiet rage. She wo meet Andy's gaze. He looks over at Claude and Gaston. Gas is restless, edgy. He grabs Claude by the collar and shak him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's happening!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like he lied to you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude breaks Gaston's grip and shoves him back in his se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Relax my friend. It's still not ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks back at Serafine. He shakes his head in disbel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I remember why I didn't want to  come to Paris. Everyone you meet is  a goddam werewolf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine stares bitterly at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope they fucking fry us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. French fries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! He's interrupted by the sound of Gaston's head snap back against the wall. His eyes bulge wide. He grins and  starts to laugh. First a little. Then a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! Ha! Haha hahaha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up, laughing, power-mad. Suddenly his body is j by a spasm and he falls to the floor. He's not laughing  anymore. He flails about wildly, croaking out strangled c gripped with a terrible seizure.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FRONT CAB
dialogues.text: The TWO GUARDS, the driver and his partner, hear the  commotion. The guard looks over to his partner, and chuck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaooooo!!! Heh heh heh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh. The driver takes a sharp turn at high sp

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Gaston flops around on the floor like a fish, grabbed by flurry of convulsions. He bites off his tongue, spitting  blood everywhere. Finally, he goes rigid with one last  seizure, then falls totally limp. Andy studies the very d corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It killed him... You coulda just  used Draino. It's cheaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him it wasn't ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude takes a folded PAPER CUP from his jacket pocket. H blows into the cup to bring it back into shape. He then t a SHARPENED STEEL TUBE from his pocket, plunges it into  Gaston's neck, and fills the cup with the blood that pour forth. Andy and Serafine are horrified. Claude puts the c of blood to his lips and pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swallows the cup of blood down in one gulp, and sits b to wait for the effects, smiling dreamily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the curse of the werewolf?  I'll tell you. The curse is to possess  such awesome power and yet be  completely unconscious of it. It may  as well belong to someone else. But  it wasn't always that way. A thousand  years ago the Gauls had a drug  powerful enough to unlock the door  to lycanthropic consciousness, to  full control. It came from  moonsbreath. A small white flower  once found in the hills of this  region, until the thick headed crusade  by our famous Saint Severin eradicated  it for all eternity. But now, thanks  to ADAM, the "curse" is over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he says this, he holds up his RIGHT ARM. It begins to  mutate and grow, reshaping his arm into the grotesque,  powerful forelimb of the beast. PLINK! His swelling wrist pops the handcuff easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Holy mother of God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude rises to his feet, triumphant. He advances towards Andy and Serafine, backing them up against the rear doors the van. He gently traces the outline of Serafine's face  with his werewolf hand. She bristles at his touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my life I've worked to unlock  the power of the unconscious mind.  Well this is it. This is power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure it's not just 'coz you jerk  off too much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude cocks his werewolf fist and SLAMS it into the back doors, inches from Andy's head. He leaves a deep dent, an opens the doors just a crack. It's a gesture that seems  calculated to frighten them. It works. Claude holds up his LEFT ARM and transforms it to match h right. It takes some effort and a little pain, but he kee a smile on his face throughout the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see what this means? I've  broken through! I'm in total control!  Not the moon! I can do whatever the  fuck I want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH!! Claude drives his left arm into the back doors, m another huge dent, and opening the crack even wider.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FRONT CAB
dialogues.text: The cops exchange worried looks. The one on the passenger side slides open the viewing panel. Claude has his back t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Hey! What's going on in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops short as Claude turns around, revealing his mons arms. Mortified, the cop reaches for the SHOT GUN under t dash. Claude races up towards the view window. As the gua pokes the muzzle through the window, Claude grabs hold of it. BLAM! The guard's shot hits the side wall. Claude rip the gun from the guard angrily, and smashes it to pieces  against the wall, grinning like the devil himself. Meanwhile ANDY throws himself at the doors, kicking them, trying in vain to break them open. He spots the SHOTGUN B on the floor and grabs it. CLAUDE reaches through the window and grabs the guard by head. He repeatedly smashes the guard's head against the  back wall of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he smashes the  guard) Don't you know... the wolf... is a  protected... species!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver freaks out, seeing his partner get his head  crushed. THE PADDY WAGON swerves all over the road. ANDY uses the shotgun barrel to twist open the lock on th van doors. As the vehicle swerves, he drops the barrel ou the door, and falls over. He calls to Serafine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She joins him and together they take a run at the back do The doors open a little, but the lock still holds. Finished with the guard, Claude turns and sees what Andy Serafine are up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Serafine take another run - it works. THE DOORS  bust open, and Andy and Serafine, still handcuffed, go  tumbling out into THE STREET, rolling on the pavement. SCREECH! HONK! Cars swerve to avoid them, just barely. CR A minivan plows into a parked car. Claude watches from th back of the van. He rears his head to the moon and smiles IN THE CAB of the paddy wagon, the driver hears an uneart howl. It's hellish. Without looking away from the road, h points his pistol through the hole in the compartment. He adjusts THE MIRROR to see into the rear compartment - The back doors are hanging open. He steals a look over his  shoulder - Other than Gaston's corpse, it's empty... He  breathes a sigh of relief and turns back to the road as - A HUGE WEREWOLF - Claude fully transformed - bursts throu the windshield and rips into him. THE PADDY WAGON is traveling over the Pont Neuf bridge. A GASOLINE TRUCK approaches from the other direction. The  werewolf leaps off of the hood just as the paddy wagon,  swerving all over the road, hits the gasoline truck head KA-BOOM!! Both vehicles explode in a fireball, smash thro the side wall of the bridge, and plunge into THE RIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc, following at a distance, is trying in vain to get paddy wagon driver on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allo! Jean-Louis! Respond! Allo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His partner slows the car. Traffic ahead is snarled. It's chaos. He taps LeDuc on the arm and points...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leduc sees the column of black smoke in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde... merde, merde, merde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams his fist against the dash angrily.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PARIS STREET, NIGHT
dialogues.text: Andy lies by the roadside, dazed, bruised, handcuffed, bu conscious. He sits up unsteadily, and looks for Serafine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a small crowd of people a little further up the r outside a small bistro. He staggers up to them and pushes his way through. Serafine is there on the ground by the c eyes closed. Kneeling beside her, he turns angrily on the onlookers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Go on! Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoos them away. Of course, they just back up a bit, s gawking at the handcuffed couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine... Get up, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy brushes away the hair from Serafine's face. He feels her neck for a pulse - she has one. But as he takes his h away, he notices a smudge of BASE MAKE-UP has rubbed off his fingers. He looks at the back of Serafine's neck and  sees that the makeup had been covering A SCAR. It bears t unmistakable star shape of the wound Andy inflicted on th werewolf that bit him. Horrified, he stands and backs away a few feet. Serafine  opens her eyes, sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Andy?... What? What is it? (she sits up, her  head clearing) Andy... are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you... That night in the  tunnels. You. You did this to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I.... Andy, you can't be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the scar where I stabbed you!  Oh God... You deliberately took me  down there so you could... God, I  can't believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine gets to her feet, a little unsteadily at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made me go there. I tried to  stop you! You wouldn't listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I? Your idea of a fuckin'  hors d'oeuvre? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! You fucking shut up! What  do you want? Huh? What the hell do  you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over, grabs a steak knife from one of the outsi tables at the bistro, and charges at Andy, pulling open h shirt... She offers him the knife, and pounds at her hear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here! Come on! Do it! Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what. Kill me. Cut out my  fucking heart. Go on! Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Andy takes the knife. He and Serafine lock eyes. For a second he's tempted, his blood boiling, heart pound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the knife aside, turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine retrieves the knife and chases after him. She ge in front of him and blocks his path. She holds the knife  point to her own chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drug was a lie, but the legend  in the church is true. Ask the undead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy just stares back at her, not knowing what to say. It all too much to believe. He shakes his head. He tries to but she moves in front of him. She's determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't both have to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening) I couldn't do it. Not to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees her looking up. He follows her gaze to the FULL M It's getting late. Andy shudders, wipes the sweat from hi brow. He's already starting to feel the heat in his blood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go through another night. I  won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy takes her hand and guides the knife away from her ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... I'm already burning up...  Look, I'm not going to go through  this another night either. But we  still have some time to get Claude.  He'll just kill more people, and  spread the curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's desperate, tears welling up in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't stop him. Not now.  Handcuffed, with no kind of weapons.  Please Andy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We have to try. We'll figure  something out. And if midnight comes  before we can get to him, well, then  we go together. Deal? (he extends a cuffed  hand) Shake a paw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs despite her tears, puts her cuffed hands over head and hugs him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where he'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere where there are no police,  and plenty to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks at her. He knows what she's driving at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc and Napier stand on the bridge, which has been bloc off, watching the tow truck drag the charred wreck of the paddy wagon from the river. Ambulances wait nearby. Firem are still putting out small piles of flaming debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Poor Bazin and Racine. At least they  brought those monsters down with  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc isn't listening - he sees something that makes his  face go slack: The paddy wagon emerges from the murky wat revealing the open, banged-up back door with several larg FIST PRINTS in it. He checks his watch - it's 11:32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French - to himself) Impossible... (to Napier - urgent) Get headquarters on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Napier isn't paid to ask questions. He hops to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Serafine emerge from the tunnel, wearing grim,  determined expressions. The party is in full swing - thro beats and sweaty dancing bodies. They walk straight acros the dance floor, pushing their way through the crowd. Amo the variety of freaky types here, no one raises an eyebro at two people in handcuffs. Serafine, who's scanning the room, is approached by a lea clad HIPSTER GUY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serafine, mon belle! Ca va?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to kiss her on both cheeks. Without breaking stri she puts her handcuffed hands on his face and shoves, sen him reeling. Serafine points out a gang of four militant skinheads off a corner. Andy nods and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This could be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make their way to the skinheads. Andy walks up to th SKINHEAD LEADER, who's got a swastika tattoo, a bad  disposition, and a fifty pound advantage on Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got something you want. Follow me.

dialogues.text: Andy and Serafine walk into A SMALL CHAMBER off the main  space. The skinhead signals his mates to come along, slip on some BRASS KNUCKLES, and follows Andy into

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAMBER
dialogues.text: The skinheads surround Andy and Serafine. There's no one  else in the room. The skinhead leader looks at Andy's  handcuffs and sniggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got, pervert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got Hitler's dick in a jar. And  the funny thing is it's still in  Goerring's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skinhead turns red with rage and throws a punch at An head. With lightning speed, Andy grabs the skinhead's fis twists his arm around his back and hurls him across the r He slams face first into the stone wall and collapses on floor with a THUD. Simultaneously, the other three skinheads attack. Serafin BASHES one across the face with both fists, sending him t the floor. The other gets her in a headlock from behind. runs backwards and - SLAM! - crushes him against the wall The third skinhead tries to kick Andy in the groin. Andy  grabs his boot and flips him over backwards - he actually does a full back flip and lands on his face. The leader groggily pulls a pistol and aims it at Andy. A snatches it out of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't even have to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) All your weapons, on the floor! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skinheads slide out some LEAD PIPES, a SWITCHBLADE,  another PISTOL, and an army surplus GRENADE. Andy and Ser scoop them up, except the lead pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neo-Nazis. Ya gotta love 'em. (to the Skinheads) Merci beau coup, monsieurs.

dialogues.text: Music cue: "After Midnight (we're gonna let it all hang o Andy's gun is pressed against the chain on Serafine's  handcuffs - BANG! The chain is broken. BANG! She returns favor and his chain is broken. They walk into the DRIPPING, dank tunnel, away from the p which fades away in the background. Each carries a pistol and a flashlight. BEADS OF SWEAT appear on their forehead The tunnel tilts downhill. Heavier DRIPPING. They turn a  corner and... SLAM! Something barrels into them - it's a HYSTERICAL GIR She's about nineteen and splattered with blood. She SCREA uncontrollably. Serafine holds her by the shoulders, tryi to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Ahhhhhhhh! A monster! My God! It got  my boyfriend! Noooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ou!? Ou est le monstre!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh! Let me go! Let me gooooo!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's off the deep end, flailing at Serafine, who keeps t to calm her down. There's no time for this. Andy presses gun to her temple. She shuts up and stares at him with wi terror stricken eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, firm) Ou est le monstre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points back down the tunnel she came out of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) Down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets her go. She starts SCREAMING again and continues disappearing into darkness. Andy winces and holds his ear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder he let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run in the direction she pointed. They arrive at the intersection with A STAIRWAY to the right. They start dow it. They see something up ahead - SOMEONE'S HAND is sticking out on the ground from a passa at a landing on the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand moves a bit, pulls back and disappears into the  crossing passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alive. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hurry down to the landing, shine their light into th passage. The hand is severed, and A BIG RAT is dragging i along with some difficulty. A dozen or other rats munch o scraps of flesh scattered over a grisly mess of blood and body parts. Andy and Serafine stare at it for a moment.  Suddenly Andy looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. I can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disturbed) It's making me hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beast HOWL echoes through the tunnels. Serafine shines flashlight on some bloody beast foot/paw prints leading d the stairs. They follow the bloody prints down the stairs and come to ancient ARCHED DOORWAY with a skull set in the arch and a chiseled inscription. Andy points to the inscription.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "Stop! Beyond this passage lie the  catacombs of Paris: the exclusive  domain of the dead."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy gestures back to the bloody remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll say we're with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the gate and enter

dialogues.speaker: THE CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: Andy shines his flashlight around, illuminating two large tunnels which lead into a twisting, intestinal maze, line from floor to ceiling with HUMAN SKULLS and FEMURS. The b form the building blocks of the tunnel walls and are arra in various patterns - from crucifixes to Masonic pyramids and even pentagrams. Ground water seeps from the ceilings and walls, DRIPPING over the eroded, crumbling bones. Despite the situation, Andy can't help but be dumb struck the spectacular necropolis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the revolution, the Paris  cemeteries overflowed. They dug up  all the old bodies and brought them  here. Seven million people. Mostly  very poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty stylish digs for a bunch of  paupers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they are French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another eerie HOWL echoes through the maze. Andy looks do both main tunnels - the howl seems to come from each of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These tunnels must loop around and  connect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go from both ends. We'll cut  him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him. They're both sweating heavily now. She st off to the right. He watches her go for a moment and then walks down the other skull lined tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHARRED BODIES of Gaston and the two cops lie on the  river bank, near the wreck. LeDuc surveys them with a few other cops. Napier leans out of a nearby car with a radio handset. The bells of nearby Notre Dame begin to ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French) It's headquarters sir. They got a  report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc rushes over and grabs the handset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (French - into radio) What've you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a crazy call from a girl,  probably fucked up on drugs. I  wouldn't bother you but you said  call with anything unusual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about a monster,  underground, in the catacombs under  Place Denfert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need two tactical assault squads  at Place Denfert immediately. You  can tell the commissioner it's a  code red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Inspector, this girl, I wouldn't  call her reliable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeDuc throws the handset back at Napier. The church bells strike twelve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy walks along carefully, shining the flashlight ahead him, his gun at the ready. His breathing gets heavier. Hi face gets redder. More sweat. His heart pounds in his ear The tunnel follows a serpentine path, with many smaller  passages and anterooms off to the sides. Andy sees some flickering light reflecting off the wet sk up ahead. He approaches it. It's coming out of AN ANTECHA He holds his gun out in front of him and steps quietly. H peers into the antechamber and finds

dialogues.speaker: TWO HALF EATEN BODIES
dialogues.text: It's the old hag and the wino he saw in the tunnels at th first party. They've been killed very recently - blood st drips from their gaping wounds. He kneels over the wino's body. There's a big chunk missi from his neck. Andy stares at the BLOODY FLESH, transfixe He shudders with a sudden spasm. His breathing gets quick More sweat. He reaches towards the wound, his hand shakin and touches the flesh. Blood runs down his fingers. He sl brings his hand back towards his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Andy. Fight it with  everything you've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks up to see UNCLE TERRENCE, stumps and all, sitt across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Terrence, you're...

dialogues.text: She reaches up feebly and manages to grab the SWITCHBLADE from his back pocket. She clicks it open and hands it to  Andy.

dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.text: Andy's shaking, shuddering - his breathing erratic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakily presses the gun to his own head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't, Andy. Stop Claude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks up. Terrence, Marcel, Amy, and a dozen other  mutilated, rotting undead, presumably Serafine's victims, stand in the tunnel, looking on solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way works for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you better hurry.

dialogues.text: Claude's stentorian voice echo's from beyond a curve in t tunnel.
